docBody.head: MARGARET SANGER'S OWN CORNER

p.q: A Correspondent writes "Do you think it is wrong to bring myself around when I am not yet three months overtime?

docBody.p: Answer When you use the term "bring myself around," you are referring to abortion. I believe that repeated abortions, however early they are brought on, have a very bad effect on a woman's health. I do not advise it even by skilled hands, unless it has been recommended by your physician. I strongly advise you against taking drugs for any such purpose. Drugs are frequently useless and always injurious. They injure the mother and if they fail of their purpose, as they often do, they are apt to injure the child. The practice of abortion gets you nowhere, for pregnancy comes again more easily after abortion than before, and it becomes necessary to go through it all again. Abortion is not the right means of controlling the size of your family. One of the strong reasons for urging Birth Control is that the scientific prevention of conception makes abortion unnecessary, and will thus do away with this evil thing.
